Prerequisites: COMPLETION OF BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION IN ACCOUNTING, ASSOCIATES OF ARTS LEVEL COURSES
Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES A COMPREHENSIVE OVERVIEW OF THE CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK OF THE AMERICAN PUBLIC COMPANY REPORTING STANDARDS. THE COURSE INCLUDES FINANCIAL REPORTING, REVIEW OF THE ACCOUNTING CYCLES, EXTENSIVE DISCUSSION OF THE ELEMENTS OF THE BALANCE SHEET, INCOME STATEMENT AND THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS. ALSO COVERED IS THE REVENUE/RECEIVABLE CASH CYCLE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING AND ACCOUNTING STANDARDS.
2. THE CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK UNDERLYING FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING
3.UNDERSTAND  AND APPLY THE ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM
4. INCOME STATEMENTS AND RELATED INFORMATION
5. BALANCE SHEETS AND STATEMENTS OF CASH FLOW
6. ACCOUNTING AND THE TIME VALUE OF MONEY
7.  CASH AND RECEIVABLES
8. VALUATION OF INVENTORIES.

1.HAVE AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF THE CONCEPTUAL FOUNDATIONS OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING THEORETICAL CONCEPTS
2.HAVE A DETAILED UNDERSTANDING OF THE CONTENT OF THE BALANCE SHEET AND INCOME STATEMENT
3.BE ABLE TO PREPARE A STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS
4.HAVE AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE REVENUE/RECEIVABLES/CASH CYCLE
Textbook(s):
INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING (LATEST EDITION)
 KIESO, WEYGANDT & WARFIELD/WILEY
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
